results.content:
This is a good course in which it truly takes your hand and guides you through but be aware that not always will it be clear.
You're only seeing the code itself and listening to Shahzaib, there are no schematics or any visual cue to what the code is doing. I'm a strong visual learner, if I wanted to read code/text I would've bought a book.
Because you only see the code and the computated result, you're not given a clear explanation as to what the code is doing.
My opinion is based on chapter 1, might edit it further down the line.
results.content_html:
This is a good course in which it truly takes your hand and guides you through but be aware that not always will it be clear.
You're only seeing the code itself and listening to Shahzaib, there are no schematics or any visual cue to what the code is doing. I'm a strong visual learner, if I wanted to read code/text I would've bought a book.
Because you only see the code and the computated result, you're not given a clear explanation as to what the code is doing.

results.content: I am rating the quality of the content. Shahzaib is clearly a competent web developer with a very lively style of delivery. This is an excellent course for beginners as well as for others looking to buck up their ideas.  The use of mysqli is to be commended and I think beginners would benefit from this approach before moving on to something like PDO, particularly as his programming style is very easy to follow.

This is an excellent course for beginners as well as for others looking to buck up their ideas. The use of mysqli is to be commended and I think beginners would benefit from this approach before moving on to something like PDO, particularly as his programming style is very easy to follow.

results.content:
Sehr lange Einführung die sich viel zu klein Unterteilt und viel Zeit kostet. Beim Aufbau des CMS und Nutzung von Bootstrap und Co. wird zwar alles erklärt, aber nicht auf die Grundlagen und Konzepte dahinter eingegangen. Es wird einfach nur runter gekaut. Es fehlten auch Verweise auf die existierende Doku.

Dazu wird noch so etwas wie mysqli beigebracht anstelle von prepared statements - das Material ist von Ende 2015? Das sollte auf keinen Fall mehr so sein!

Eher meh!
results.content_html:

results.content: Very, very good. I recommended.

The teacher is speaking way too quick for people that doesn't know what he's talking about yet. And since this is a course, you can assume that people doesn't always know what you're talking about. Speak slower, please.

After a few lessons, the teacher's accent is really getting annoying. Also, the fact that he keeps repeating the same information over and over again doesn't really help. This could easily be the worst course I've taken so far.
results.content_html:
The teacher is speaking way too quick for people that doesn't know what he's talking about yet. And since this is a course, you can assume that people doesn't always know what you're talking about. Speak slower, please.

results.content:
The teacher who made the intro is a good english speaker but the teacher who  speaks the rest of the course has a bad accent and is very difficult to understand.
Some programming things are not the best. For example two db files. Only one file is enough. You don't need a second one in the admin folder.
One more point is the last video which is complete black. The voice is there, but you can see nothing.

I bought this course a while ago but if I had known that, I would not have bought the course

But it is nice to see a complete site at the end.

results.content: This is what I looking for, a good tutorial of how to code php, html, and even with bootstrap in single courses alongside with nice study case project with simple but understandable explanation in every video, refreshing my mind because it have been a long time since I code again. Unfortunately, this course order of explanation is not good enough because after explaining something in order, suddenly go to another topic, I hope in the future this course can have a better order of explanation for example explaining about the frontend section first (building the pages using html and bootstrap) from the header until the footer, then backend section (building the management process using php and mysql) and then the last is the study case of how to build a cms system. But overall this course is good, thank you very much !
results.content_html: This is what I looking for, a good tutorial of how to code php, html, and even with bootstrap in single courses alongside with nice study case project with simple but understandable explanation in every video, refreshing my mind because it have been a long time since I code again. Unfortunately, this course order of explanation is not good enough because after explaining something in order, suddenly go to another topic, I hope in the future this course can have a better order of explanation for example explaining about the frontend section first (building the pages using html and bootstrap) from the header until the footer, then backend section (building the management process using php and mysql) and then the last is the study case of how to build a cms system. But overall this course is good, thank you very much !

If all of the classes were there I'd give this class 4 stars.

results.content:
This course is the biggest example of being hoodwinked I have ever seen. The guy (Joe Parys) who intros the course is very well spoken and talks it up like it's the best course on the net. However, once you get into the lessons, the instructor (Shahzaib Kamal) is a guy from Pakistan who is very hard to understand and just isn't a very good teacher (in English). He obviously knows the content very well, but has a hard time conveying his message. I'm sure he would be outstanding teaching in his native language. 

The other thing is it's NOT a "complete" PHP course. Every lesson was rushed and the content was specific to the "CMS System" he's teaching you to create. The content on MySQL and phpMyAdmin was laughable at best all due to the language barrier. I came here to refresh my skills after a 10 year absence from the industry. Had I not had previous programming experience I would've been totally lost. I didn't even get halfway through before I threw in the towel. This course is a total waste of time. 

In my frustration I went out on YouTube and found a channel with free courses that blow this one out of the water. Do not waste your time on this.
results.content_html:
This course is the biggest example of being hoodwinked I have ever seen. The guy (Joe Parys) who intros the course is very well spoken and talks it up like it's the best course on the net. However, once you get into the lessons, the instructor (Shahzaib Kamal) is a guy from Pakistan who is very hard to understand and just isn't a very good teacher (in English). He obviously knows the content very well, but has a hard time conveying his message. I'm sure he would be outstanding teaching in his native language.

The other thing is it's NOT a "complete" PHP course. Every lesson was rushed and the content was specific to the "CMS System" he's teaching you to create. The content on MySQL and phpMyAdmin was laughable at best all due to the language barrier. I came here to refresh my skills after a 10 year absence from the industry. Had I not had previous programming experience I would've been totally lost. I didn't even get halfway through before I threw in the towel. This course is a total waste of time.

In my frustration I went out on YouTube and found a channel with free courses that blow this one out of the water. Do not waste your time on this.

results.content: To be honest, nothing against the instructor, but I don't think he should run training courses. The english is difficult to understand at times and he present the course in a way, thinking you already know how to develop. The code editor was not even provided/explained in this course yet he is coding in it. So he explains the use of Xamp, but should he not also mention he is using Atom for coding? When you type or start to code in a course, at least explain what you are doing, what is a variable, what is echo.... etc. Just my feedback, and when i thought i  was buying this course i thought i had a proper english instructor, bit misleading...
results.content_html: To be honest, nothing against the instructor, but I don't think he should run training courses. The english is difficult to understand at times and he present the course in a way, thinking you already know how to develop. The code editor was not even provided/explained in this course yet he is coding in it. So he explains the use of Xamp, but should he not also mention he is using Atom for coding? When you type or start to code in a course, at least explain what you are doing, what is a variable, what is echo.... etc. Just my feedback, and when i thought i was buying this course i thought i had a proper english instructor, bit misleading...

results.content:
I'm here for the bootstrap.. not for php.

PHP: The php and the whole coding-style I see in this course is terrible. Noone should ever learn such bad coding-style in a beginner course. The php code gets duplicated to several files and when there is one thing to change you have to do it in all files.

Bootstrap: There are no explanations for the used bootstrap classes or tutorials how to get the snippets from the bootstrap documentation. So this course should address people that already know bootstrap (?).
results.content_html:
I'm here for the bootstrap.. not for php.

PHP: The php and the whole coding-style I see in this course is terrible. Noone should ever learn such bad coding-style in a beginner course. The php code gets duplicated to several files and when there is one thing to change you have to do it in all files.

Bootstrap: There are no explanations for the used bootstrap classes or tutorials how to get the snippets from the bootstrap documentation. So this course should address people that already know bootstrap (?).
